intro: Psychotria carstensensis, commonly known as the Carstensens psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria carstensensis is also notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
